lead_paragraph: The knife had been kept since the late 1990s by a retired officer who claimed it was found at the home where Mr. Simpson lived at the time of the murders.

byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña and Katie Rogers contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: News of a Knife Being Tested for DNA Spurs Frenzy in Simpson Case
headline.main: Police Test Knife Reportedly Found on Property Once Owned by O.J. Simpson

snippet: The knife had been kept since the late 1990s by a retired officer who claimed it was found at the home where Mr. Simpson lived at the time of the murders.
abstract: Los Angeles Police Dept announces it has acquired knife supposedly found around 1998 during demolition of former home of O J Simpson and kept for number of years by retired police officer; find reignites public interest in murder of Simpson's wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ronald L Goldman; police warn knife may be unrelated to case.
